definition: to lengthen/to pull sth out longer
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to pull a long face/to scowl

sentences.english: In one case it began stretching its neck just before the food was delivered.
sentences.chinese: 有一次它在食物送到之前就拉長了脖子。

sentences.english: The additional troops quickly divided the North Korean forces, which had been stretched from north to south.
sentences.chinese: 增援部隊迅速分，被拉長了，從南到北朝鮮的力量。

sentences.english: Lengthen the tailbone away from the back of your pelvis.
sentences.chinese: 拉長尾椎骨遠離盆骨的後側。

sentences.english: No puckering or stretching of fabric when zipper is inserted.
sentences.chinese: 當拉鍊裝上後布料外觀不能起皺或拉長。

sentences.english: The nanotubes are elongated, hollow cylinders of carbon atoms.
sentences.chinese: 納米管是由碳原子拉長的空心圓筒。

sentences.english: They offered the Spanish queens an elongated pearl they named Peregrina .
sentences.chinese: 他們爲西班牙皇后拉長了珍珠他們命名佩雷格里納。

sentences.english: Using the same hand would overstretch your fingers.
sentences.chinese: 使用一隻手按組合鍵會過分拉長你的手指。

sentences.english: but it has to give the perfect shape and elongate the legs to the maximum.
sentences.chinese: 但是這就要求有完美的鞋型並且最大限度的拉長雙腿。

sentences.english: My wool coat stretched when I washed it.
sentences.chinese: 我的羊毛大衣經我一洗就被拉長了。

sentences.english: Here in Poznan , debate seems to be stunted and the process drawn out.
sentences.chinese: 波滋南這兒的爭論看來哽上了，過程看來要拉長。

sentences.english: Moon water, glittering, slightly elongated shadow is the lake.
sentences.chinese: 望月水中，波光粼粼，微微月影被湖面拉長。

sentences.english: He stretched the rubber band till it snapped.
sentences.chinese: 他拉長橡皮筋，啪地一聲拉斷了。

sentences.english: " Rather, "it has an elongated rhombohedral structure.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它有一種拉長的斜方六面體結構。

sentences.english: The skirt hemline should be at or below your knee to slim and lengthen your look.
sentences.chinese: 裙子的底邊及膝以下可以拉長身材。

sentences.english: The Dolphin pose in yoga presses the forearms against a wall as it elongates the spine.
sentences.chinese: 海豚在瑜伽姿勢壓在牆上的前臂，因爲它拉長脊柱。

definition: line (in drawing, calligraphy etc)/the lines or contours of a three-dimensional object (hairstyle, clothing, car etc)
to overlap/to superimpose/to telescope/to run together/to duplicate/one over another/superposition/an overlap/redundancy/reduplication (in Chinese grammar, e.g. 散散步[san4 san4 bu4] to have a stroll)
Yanchang county in Yan'an 延安[Yan2 an1], Shaanxi
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
